items: A deafened creature can't hear and automatically fails any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} that requires hearing.

When a deafened creature casts a spell with a verbal component, it has to make an {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} using its spellcasting ability. The DC equals 8 + the spell's level. Cantrips count as level 0 for this check. On a failure, the spell fails and has no effect.
A charmed creature can't attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects.
The charmer has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} to interact socially with the creature.

Some special abilities and environmental hazards, such as starvation and the long-term effects of freezing or scorching temperatures, can lead to a special condition called exhaustion. Exhaustion is measured in six levels. An effect can give a creature one or more levels of exhaustion, as specified in the effect's description.

rows: {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}

items: If an already exhausted creature suffers another effect that causes exhaustion, its current level of exhaustion increases by the amount specified in the effect's description.

A creature suffers the effect of its current level of exhaustion as well as all lower levels. For example, a creature suffering level 2 exhaustion has its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} halved and has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}.
An effect that removes exhaustion reduces its level as specified in the effect's description, with all exhaustion effects ending if a creature's exhaustion level is reduced below 1.

Finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir} reduces a creature's exhaustion level by 1, provided that the creature has also ingested some food and drink. Also, being raised from the dead reduces a creature's exhaustion level by 1.
A frozen creature is covered along with any object it is wearing or carrying, in a thick layer of ice. Its weight increases by a factor of four, and it ceases aging.
The creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
The creature has vulnerability to bludgeoning and fire damage and {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all other damage.
The creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized.
A grappled creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
The condition ends if the grappler is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}.
The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the {@spell Thunderwave|Ishiir} spell.
A lacerated creature takes damage equal to twice the original attacker's {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} modifier at the start of every one of its turns.
If the affected creature receives magical healing or another regenerative effect, it is no longer lacerated.
Additionally, the creature or another creature can use a healing kit as an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} to staunch the bleeding and remove the condition.
A prone creature's only movement option is to crawl, unless it stands up and thereby ends the condition.
The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls}.

An {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} against the creature has {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. Otherwise, the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
A blinded creature can't see and automatically fails any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir} that requires sight.

{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}, and the creature's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.

condition.name: Concentration
entries: Some spells and other effects require Concentration to remain active, as specified in their descriptions. If the effect's creator loses Concentration, the effect ends. If the effect has a maximum duration, the effect's description specifies how long the creator can concentrate on it: up to 1 minute, 1 hour, or some other duration. The creator can end Concentration at any time (no action required). The following factors break Concentration.

items.name: Another Concentration Effect.
items.entry: You lose Concentration on an effect the moment you start casting a spell that requires Concentration or activate another effect that requires Concentration.

items.name: Damage.
items.entry: If you take damage, you must succeed on a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} to maintain Concentration. The DC equals 10 or half the damage taken (round down), whichever number is higher.

items.name: Incapacitated or Dead.
items.entry: Your Concentration ends if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} condition or you die.

items: A confused creature cannot make {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions} and rolls a {@dice d10} at the start of every one of its turns to determine its behaviour that turn.

rows: The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} this turn.
The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn.
The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.
The creature can act and move normally.

condition.name: Surprised
entries: The DM determines who might be {@condition Surprised|Ishiir} at the start of combat. If neither side tries to be stealthy, they automatically notice each other. Otherwise, the DM compares the Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks of anyone hiding with the passive Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) score of each creature on the opposing side. Any character or monster that doesn't notice a threat is {@condition Surprised|Ishiir} at the start of the encounter.

If you're {@condition Surprised|Ishiir}, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on your initiative roll and you can't take a {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} until the start of your first turn. A member of a group can be {@condition Surprised|Ishiir} even if the other members aren't.
If you're unnoticed at the start of combat, you have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir} on your initiative roll.

items: A dazed creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws} and cannot take {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions}.
A dazed creature moves at half its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.
On its turn, it can only take an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} OR {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, but not both; it can only make one attack with either.

If the creature attempts to {@action Magic|Ishiir|cast a spell} with a casting time of 1 action, the creature rolls a {@dice d20}. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn and the creature must use its action to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted.

A frightened creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} and {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} while the source of its fear is within line of sight.
The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
A poisoned creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} and {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks}.
A restrained creature's {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir} becomes 0, and it can't benefit from any bonus to its {@variantrule Speed|Ishiir}.

{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}, and the creature's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}.
The creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
A dominated creature is beholden to its dominator's commands, overriding its own will and allegiances.
An incapacitated creature can't take actions or {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir|Reactions}.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
A paralyzed creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir} and can't move or speak.

The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}. {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

A petrified creature is transformed, along with any nonmagical object it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Its weight increases by a factor of ten, and it ceases aging.
The creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
The creature has {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to all damage.
The creature is {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir|Immune} to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized.
A stunned creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, can't move, and can speak only falteringly.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
An unconscious creature is {@condition Incapacitated|Ishiir}, can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings.
The creature drops whatever it's holding and falls {@condition Prone|Ishiir}.
The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir|Saving Throws}.
{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
Any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature.

An invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of hiding, the creature is heavily obscured. The creature's location can be detected by any noise it makes or any tracks it leaves.

{@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} against the creature have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir}, and the creature's {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} have {@variantrule Advantage|Ishiir}.
